CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1952, pg. 16 reads: "Joint Effort - Top officials of the chain of Robinson stores in eighty-two cities, met at the Courier Tuesday to discuss ways and means of making the fifteen million member Negro market more conscious of Robinson merchandise and price advantages. Left to right: Otto Loewenthal, district supervisor; Mrs. Robert L. Vann, Courier president; Stanley Barnett, publicity director; Miss Sylvia Drexler, advertising manager, George W. Shanahan, general manager.  At extreme right (with charts) J.W. Carroll, assistant manager of Chicago Interstate Advertising department of the Courier, demonstrates how the courier can carry the Robinson message into the homes which make up the Negro market. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Otto Loewenthal, Jessie Vann, Stanley Barnett, Sylvia Drexler, and George W. Shanahan, watching presentation by J.W. Carroll, gathered in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper Offices
